answers.answer: What medications is she on?If she is on metformin, have her B12 levels tested.Make sure she has excellent blood sugar control is my strongest advice.  High blood sugar causes circulatory and neurological (nerve) problems, both of which could be contributing.What is her fasting BS levels?What are her BS levels 2 hours after eating?What is her latest HA1C result?
I would have her see a Podiatrist a foot dr..Im sure its because of her Diabetes.

question: My mother is a diabetic. When she stands after about ten minutes her toes begin to draw inward. This is very painful for her, she says it also feels like putting your toes in a light socket. The doctors are telling her they hav no idea what this is or how to treat it. Please help with any information about these symptoms.
title: wits end
